definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: When inflexible rules are imposed on flexible humans, both sides lose.
sentences.chinese: 当死板的规则强加在灵活的人类身上时，两面皆输。

sentences.english: There is a sequence imposed on you by the author.
sentences.chinese: 作者将强加于你一个固有的顺序。

sentences.english: Banning the representation of an enemy is imposing nationalism on entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 限制敌人代表是在娱乐游戏中强加民族主义。

sentences.english: Such all or nothing reasoning is imposed upon Scripture, not drawn from it.
sentences.chinese: 这种全有或全无的推理是强加的经文，并非取自它。

sentences.english: That is why we must never aim to impose our own views on others.
sentences.chinese: 这正是我们决不尝试将自己的观点强加于人的原因。

sentences.english: There are facts which I would not obtrude upon a child.
sentences.chinese: 有些事实不应该强加于儿童。

sentences.english: Instead of imposing personal views upon others, we should promote democracy.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该发扬民主，而不应该将个人观点强加于他人。

sentences.english: Don't obtrude your ideas upon others.
sentences.chinese: 不要将你的观点强加于人。

sentences.english: "I can't stress the importance of self-esteem enough, " Zbik says.
sentences.chinese: 我不能把自尊的重要性强加上去。

sentences.english: A well scrubbed, hustling rube with a little taste.
sentences.chinese: 整洁干净而强加进一点品味的乡巴佬。

sentences.english: "We believe that the industry is trying to force-fit the PC into the living room, and it won't work, " he says.
sentences.chinese: 我们认为业界正尝试将电脑强加给客厅，这不会奏效。

sentences.english: Lovesickness is a condition brought upon us, against our will, by a force somehow external to us.
sentences.chinese: 相思病是被外力违背我们的意志强加于身上的。

sentences.english: I do not feel, however, that I have any business imposing my choices on others.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我也并不认为我应该把自己的选择强加于人。

sentences.english: But to a large extent, that identity has been imposed by society.
sentences.chinese: 而在很大程度上，这种身份选择是由社会强加的。

sentences.english: Qataris do not universally impose the style on foreigners.
sentences.chinese: 卡塔尔人通常不将这种形式强加于外国人。

sentences.english: The Constitution does not allow the state to force religion upon non-believers.
sentences.chinese: 宪法不允许国家将宗教强加于不信教者。

definition: to imbue with/to inculcate/to instill into/to teach/to impart/to channel water to another place
to put the blame on/to accuse
to avoid (esp. responsibility)/to shift (the blame)/to pass the buck
to tag sb with unfair label/power word
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
